content:
I just got this in Shortest mode and won with 33% because no one could solve the problem + the complex text manipulation in 15 minutes.

I see in another comment you made the output so complex to make shortest mode harder, but you've made it way too hard (and frustrating) to be a fun clash.

The core problem is a good clash, but the unnecessary text manipulation takes up most of your time in the clash and unfortunately it's very hard to debug because the output is so long that you can't see the part that differs from the "Expected" output in the debugger. I got stuck and couldn't fix beyond the first two tests.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That is a great clash and the shortest mode is very hard(good) for it.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte bien
your return is very long as a text if you can just do the exchange result it will be better in my opinion but well done

Goal
* Please state what the rounding requirement is.

Input
* Please format "INR for" as a {{constant}}.

* Please mention that [[indian_currency_amount]] and [[foreign_currency_amount]] are floats.

Output
* Please reformat/revise as follows:

If the input is valid:
<<Line 1:>> {{Following the conversion rate of 1}} [[foreign_currency_name]] {{=}} [[currency exchange rate]] {{INR, the exchange amount is}} [[remark]]

where [[remark]] is one of the following:
• {{ok :)}}
• {{less by [[XXX]] INR :(}}
• {{more by [[XXX]] INR.}}

If the input is invalid:
<<Line 1:>> {{Invalid input.}}

Constraints
* Please change "EUR or INR" to "or EUR".

* Please format "USD", "CNY" and "EUR" as {{constants}}.

Cases
* Please remove the current Test 4 and Validator 4, and instead, write some additional pairs of cases where there may be missing foreign currency and/or wrong foreign currency and/or missing foreign currency amount and/or missing Indian currency amount. (Also, Input section may have to be revised accordingly.)

Thanks.
Thanks, issues and suggestions given by you have been taken into account and the post has been updated
Hi! The result is purposefully long to make it harder for Shorter mode
we can take coppy/past is not for harder  that

it is easy to do, but increases code length. Shortest mode aims to have lowest code length. So having to type such a long sentence will pose a challenge to players for doing it more efficiently. hope you understand

Actually, the challenger cannot change such long texts without breaking the rules, which increases the base character length for everyone. The challenge with shortest mode is to have the least characters that the rules allow. But your code unnecessarily raises that base line. In challenger mode, strings that are preset by the rules cannot be changed.

but at least it gives a challenge to people to add conversion rate 2 times in the same code - either they be efficient by borrowing the conversion rate from calculation code or they can simply type it again, but increasing character count (this code give disadvantage if you are not efficient)

im open to hearing your thoughts on this

This baseline of characters is there for every player, which needlessly increases the baseline. They have to meet the requirements or give up. And also, you can simply use ctrl+c and ctrl+v to copy it letter for letter. Shortest mode is not about time sure, but this just puts a stone in every players path. Which does not provide any sort of advantage to any player, in fact it's quite the opposite.

Thank you.

In Output section, would you please consider changing "<currency exchange rate>" to "[[currency exchange rate]]"?
